unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities News Snippet: Solar Rooftop Subsidies**
normalised: Energy and Utilities News Snippet: Solar Rooftop Subsidies

unnormalised: Good news, folks! Thinking of going solar? The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) is still offering some sweet subsidies for rooftop solar installations. This Diwali, ditch the noisy firecrackers and invest in some clean energy instead!
normalised: Good news, folks! Thinking of going solar? The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) is still offering some sweet subsidies for rooftop solar installations. This Diwali, ditch the noisy firecrackers and invest in some clean energy instead!

unnormalised: Word on the street is that the application process has been streamlined – no more endless visits to the electricity board, thankfully. Subsidies can cover up to 40% of the installation cost for systems up to 3kW, perfect for most homes. For larger systems (3kW to 10kW), it's capped at a lower percentage, but still worth checking out.
normalised: Word on the street is that the application process has been streamlined – no more endless visits to the electricity board, thankfully. Subsidies can cover up to forty percent of the installation cost for systems up to three kilowatt, perfect for most homes. For larger systems (three kilowatt to ten kilowatt), it's capped at a lower percentage, but still worth checking out.

unnormalised: Rajesh from Bangalore installed his system last Onam and says his electricity bill has practically vanished! He's using the savings to treat his family to extra biryani every week.
normalised: Rajesh from Bangalore installed his system last Onam and says his electricity bill has practically vanished! He's using the savings to treat his family to extra biryani every week.

unnormalised: Remember, these subsidies vary state-wise, so contact your local distribution company (like BESCOM in Karnataka) to get the exact details. Last day to apply for this phase is rumoured to be 31st Dec, so hurry up! Don't miss out on this chance to save money and go green, all thanks to a little help from the Govt. of India!
normalised: Remember, these subsidies vary state-wise, so contact your local distribution company (like B E S C O M in Karnataka) to get the exact details. Last day to apply for this phase is rumoured to be thirty first December, so hurry up! Don't miss out on this chance to save money and go green, all thanks to a little help from the Government of India!
